Reviews.Title: “Amazing view and great service”
Reviews.Author: Jossie R
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice ans secluded small inn. It does not have a lot of rooms, which makes it very unique and quiet. The pool is very nice, but the view is absolutely worth it. On clear days you can see the island of Vieques on the Horizon. The service is great and if you are a little adventurous you can follow a "trail" behind the pool area that leads you to the ocean and big rocks: perfect for some pictures but not to swim.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view - no frills”
Reviews.Author: Jannorman
Reviews.Content: The room was alittle small for a family of 4. They did give us a an air mattress for one of our kids. The beds are ok, tv worked but very old (we didn't go there to watch tv), frig, microwave, AC was too cold (we don't have AC in our home in PR), very nice pool, an excellent view, and lastly if you have small children they have a play ground. My 2 year old loved it. I suggest staying on the top floors to see the beautiful sun sets and rises. They office staff was very friendly and helpful. Overall we had a very relaxing time.

Reviews.Title: “Dark and smelly room”
Reviews.Author: nygirl1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights in November. Advise: do not take a room in the building where the reception is. The other rooms seem to be reasonable (from the reviews). Our room was really dark, it smelt horrible and it did not feel very clean. The microwave and the fridge was great as well as the breakfast. You get a menu and the make what you like. All in all I probabely would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view. I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: noblehalogen
Reviews.Content: First of all the service at the front desk was great. We had made a mistake when making our reservation and they fixed it in a matter of seconds. Second...the property is really well kept and the views are beautiful. The beach, sunsets and sunrises looked splendid from our room. The rooms have a Fridge and a Microwave which was really nice. The things I didn't liked that much is that since rooms have a small private balcony if the people at the other rooms are making noise you can hear them clearly. Also we never got to enjoy the Breakfast because (is nice that they make everything at the moment) most of the time we woke up late and once we waited for almost 10 minutes and since they were cooking for another guests they never showed up. TV was outdated and didn't have too much channels. It has a nice pool with views of the beach. This place has good potential and is perfect if you want to stay away from the metropolitan area and just enjoy the beach in a more quiet setting.

Reviews.Title: “Surely the best there is in the neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Gustav1905
Reviews.Content: Two travelers from Europe (currently resinding in NYC & DC) April, 17-24 2009 Yes, the Parador Costa del Mar has clean rooms, 12 of them with a terrific view over the lawn, the lush trees on to the marvelous blue-green sea. Over a busy weekend these rooms were taken and we got a dark "cell" to the side without above mentioned advantages; but the staff were nice and helpful and offered to move us to an ocean view room on Sunday night. The hammocks on the green lawn invite you for an afternoon nap. But do also climb downhill to the beach - a rope will serve as a handrail - and you will reach the ocean over the rocks. Breakfast was served Monday to Friday half a mile away at the Parador Palmas de Lucia, owned by the same family. This was principally not a problem but the surroundings have clearly seen better times: the littered beach and the welcome "team" in front of the Parador, in form of half a dozen stray dogs, were definitely less than inviting. The Parador Costa del Mare's address, Route 901, highly praised even by Lonely Planet, is in fact by no means as spectacular as described: Dense traffic, no scenic overlooks, an oil refinery and some industrial ruins as well as reckless drivers. And don't expect any nice restaurants on the road or in the area at large. We are surely not picky but all there is are beer halls galore exclusively frequented by male locals and not really the place to enjoy a romantic night out. We checked out the following restaurants in the neighborhood recommended by Lonely Planet: El Nuevo Horizonte, there they gave us a tourist menu with rip off prices - green salad for about 15 Dollars, smell of lobster stew - no way. The staff didn't make any effort to serve us. Forget also Paradise Sea Food Restaurant at Naguabo or Marc's at the Melia in Ponce, the latter one being shut down. What we can, however, really recommend is Palmas del Mar, a marvelous spot (gated community) nestled on a 3 mile palm shore about 10 miles away from Parador Costa del Mar. There you can choose between a few nice restaurants for lunch or dinner: a tapas bar, Bistro Rico, a French restaurant and the rather fancy Country Club, which closes at 7 pm on week nights and 10 pm on weekends. All in all: Puerto Rico's East Coast can pride itself with unique natural beauty and a wonderful climate hence it is all the more sad to see the public infrastructure so run down.

Reviews.Title: “Great view.... not great everything else”
Reviews.Author: PRvacationer81
Reviews.Content: PROS: Great view - amazing sunset. It looks just like the pictures. The lady working at the front desk is very nice and friendly. CONS: Oh where do I start ... the place was pretty gross. Put it this way, we got our own plunger. Everything in this place is an "extra"... 25 cents for ice, you have to buy towels for the pool. In the 3 days we were there we only got hot water in the shower once. But, we were pretty happy with that considering on multiple occasions we got no water at all. That's right, no water in the sink, shower or toilet. When we walked over to the front desk (since our room did not have a phone in it - we were told it was broken and never replaced) the lady told us they were fixing some plumbing issues. For 3 days!? And, not to mention that the bathroom itself was pretty gross. It was in desperate need of calking all over, and the water (when it was working) went all over the bathroom. Our bedside table lamp didn't work. We were told it was fixed and never was. The TV is so tiny. You can get a better one free on craigslist... and it only got 2 channels (TNT being one). The wireless Internet... well, that you can ONLY get in a very very very small area. You have your choice of one bench or one tiny table. Not exactly what I was expecting. The pool was SUPER nasty. There were tons (like in the 1000s) of tiny worms in the water just floating all over. It looked like some other people didn't see them because they just jumped right in. YUCK! They do have a basketball hoop on a slab of concrete, but the basket was too low and they didn't have a working ball. The hammock was in a tree with dozens of gigantic caterpillars. EW! We didn't eat the food there, so I can't comment on that. We ended up going to the grocery store and eating sandwiches, since there are no restaurants in the area other than the hotel. Overall, for 3 days I survived. The view was nice, and I was glad to be in warm weather. I won't however, ever stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Million Dollar View”
Reviews.Author: shoejungle
Reviews.Content: We had a family vacation, my husband, and 3 children. I hadnt included the baby in the reservation who is an infant but I mentioned it at check in and they made me pay extra for him which I was quite surprised. I had a room with double beds. Rooms are nice but in my opinion a bit small. Resort was pretty clean and rooms got serviced most of the time. I believe one out of the six days my room was skipped. We had the pool to ourselves most of the time which the children enjoyed. It a nice place to stay if you want to be away from the city and the touristy areas. Its pretty remote and relaxing. Staff was overall pretty good. Breakfast was nice but mainly same things everyday. There is a great restaurant down the road called Rincon Familiar which has wonderful food. Overall my experience was good, its was pretty inexpensive so you cant expect more than that. The view is spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Secluded and Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: beth_ann_77
Reviews.Content: My best girlfriend and I were looking for a beach vacation where we could just recharge, reconnect (we live in different cities), and enjoy the sun. The Costa del Mar was PERFECT! The hotel is small, but lovely, impeccibly clean, and we had a lovely little balcony over looking the pool, but more importantly, the ocean coastline. Sunrises were spectacular. While there isn't a beach on property, there is one very close by owned by the resort, and we got in a ton of beach time on a practically abandoned beach. The quiet was perfect, sometimes we felt like the only people around, which was exactly what we were looking for! A rental car is a neccessity, but the streets of Yabucoa are easy to navigate, even when you get turned around (as we did more than once). It's a quick jaunt to many a city nearby, and my friend and I had many adventures. Oh, and breakfast! Totally yummy, made to order everyday, and the best for recharging. The room has a fridge and a microwave, so snacks are easy! The staff is super nice, they speak English, and are great with directions and recommendations. We really enjoyed our time in Puerto Rico, and if I go back, I'm going back to the quiet serenity of the Costa del Mar!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service, Wonderful View”
Reviews.Author: kidagn11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights (Aug 27-30 2007) at this family owned parador (they own 2 others; one nearby on the beach and one on the southside of the island). This property contains 16 rooms and ours was on the 3rd floor facing the Atlantic with Monkey Island just offshore. We were treated to beautiful sunrises and a full moon each night. The 400 numbered rooms are not ocean front (and are on the 3rd floor!). The rooms on the first floor would not have a direct view of the ocean although they are "ocean front" as there are some trees blocking a straight ahead view. The pool (also on the ocean side) was spotless with ample pool furniture. We watched one of the employees clean it every morning. The staff was very pleasant and professional. I had a situation arise which required use of a laptop to access a financial site and being that I had a Blackberry but no laptop with me I was afraid I was going to have a problem. I mentioned this to the front desk clerk who called the owner. A short time later the owner arrived with a laptop for my use. There is free wireless on the property. Breakfast (full) came with the room (I believe you can book a room without breakfast for a slightly reduced rate). The food was fresh and ample. English is spoken. We highly recommend this property!!

Reviews.Title: “First time for the family in P.R.”
Reviews.Author: chico18
Reviews.Content: Weâ€™ve just returned from a seven nights stay at the Parador Costa del Mar (my wife and 2 kids). I requested a room with two Queen Beds and instead I got one Queen, one small and an air mattress. I told the people in the front desk that that was not acceptable and that I will not have any of my family members sleeping on the floor for seven nights. I was told that was the only room available and there was nothing else they could do for me. I told them that I will pay for the night and in the morning I was going to look for another place to stay. When I went to check out in the morning I was told that they had a different room for us to move in with three beds. The guesthouse was clean every day (what ever they called cleaning). The coffee maker was not clean not even one time in seven days. I had to ask the staff to have the bed sheets changed. My daughter found a condom wrapper next to the as soon as we move in the new room. Some how the missed to clean the room in more than one occasion, the septic tank was leaking and there was a very bad smell coming from it. This was the first place ever that I stayed and was charged coffee. The guesthouse is really nice and quiet. There was a gentleman that worked in the front desk, I believe his name was Freddie, to him THANK YOU for all you did for me and my family, for the rest of the staff I was not impress at all. We will not be back to Parador Costa del Mar if I can help it, you will always be my last choice.

Reviews.Title: “Verry nice stay at Costa del Mar”
Reviews.Author: ezmax
Reviews.Content: Weâ€™ve just returned from a 4 nights stay at the Parador Costa del Mar (my wife, our 4yr old son and myself). The guesthouse is about a 1h15min from San Juan Airport, located on the panoramic road 901 along the Caribbean Sea. The guesthouse is small, but the rooms are comfortable and clean, the rooms on the first level are next to the well-maintained pool, so be vigilant if you have small child (they are tempted to just run in the water). The guesthouse provides a full breakfast in the morning, but for lunch an diner you have to go the near by (3 min drive) Hotel Palmas de Lucia. But for diner, we recommend a new restaurant in the area, call â€œPalmas Del Marâ€� (also) about 15 min drive on route 901. The guesthouse is really nice and quiet. We were there over the president day weekend, and it was full, but we were not disturbed by noise. The location is also nice, you absolutely need a car, we took day trips to the rain forest, and to Ponce. We will be back to Parador Costa del Mar, itâ€™s not the Ritz Carlton, but it â€˜s a really nice place were you get your money worth.

HotelInfo.Name: Parador Costa del Mar
HotelInfo.Address: Carr Panoramica Rd 901, Km 5.6 | PO Box 1746, Yabucoa 00767, Puerto Rico
